symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3
symbols.description: Controls that implement the SAP User Experience (UX) Guidelines 3.0

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellPersonalization
properties.description:
Experimental implementation of visual Ux3 Shell personalization / branding.

DO NOT USE PRODUCTIVELY!!!

Being completely non-generic as of now, this is supposed to facilitate discussions with Ux about the personalization capabilities. Once that concept is more final, we can go for a cleaner implementation, considering the number of configurable properties etc.
Deprecated as of version 1.36. This class was never released for productive use and will never be.

experimental.text: The Shell-features Personalization, Color Picker and “Inspect”-Tool are only experimental work and might change or disappear in future versions.

deprecated.text: This class was never released for productive use and will never be.

symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.ux3
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
symbols.description:
A special toolbar with predefined social actions which can be shown as needed. These are: Create an update (Feed), Follow, Mark for Follow Up, Mark as Favorite and Open Thing.

In addition business actions (ThingAction instances) can be added which are either displayed as MenuItems of the 'More' menu button or as individual tool bar buttons.

When using this control, please be aware that it fulfills rather specific requirements: it has been designed for and is used within composite controls QuickView and ThingInspector.

properties.name: alwaysShowMoreMenu
properties.description: If true, business actions are rendered as menu items of the 'More' menu button. Otherwise, 'More' menu button is only displayed for overflow and business actions are rendered as inidividual buttons.

properties.name: dividerWidth
properties.description: The minimum width of ActionBar's the social actions part: business action controls have to be rendered outside this area

properties.name: favoriteState
properties.description: Indicates whether “Favorite” is active

properties.name: flagState
properties.description: Indicates whether “Mark for Follow Up” is active

properties.name: followState
properties.description: Keeps track of the actionBars Follow/Unfollow button’s state. Its value is one of - FollowActionState.Default - FollowActionState.Follow - FollowActionState.Hold

properties.name: showFavorite
properties.description: Indicates whether social action “Favorite” is shown, default is ‘true’

properties.name: showFlag
properties.description: Indicates whether social action “Mark for Follow Up” is shown, default is ‘true’

properties.name: showFollow
properties.description: Indicates whether social action “Follow” is shown, default is ‘true’

properties.name: showOpen
properties.description: Indicates whether social action “Open” is shown, default is ‘true’

properties.name: showUpdate
properties.description: Indicates whether social action “Update” is shown, default is ‘true’

properties.name: thingIconURI
properties.description: The thing icon uri. Icon will be displayed in Feeder

properties.name: updateState
properties.description: Indicates whether “Update” is active

aggregations.name: _businessActionButtons
aggregations.description: Buttons for the business actions - managed by this ActionBar

aggregations.name: _socialActions
aggregations.description: The social actions which are managed by this ActionBar

aggregations.name: businessActions
aggregations.description: Displayed on the actionBar's right hand-side, either as menu item under 'More' or as individual buttons

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ActionBar.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: actionSelected

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of selected ThingAction

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Selected ThingAction

parameters.name: newState
parameters.description: New State of the selected action.Only filled if the respective action maintains a state property, for example 'FollowUp' or 'Favorite'

events.description:
Fired when any of the social action’s toolbar buttons except ‘Update’ or any of the business action’s menu items resp. buttons is pressed. The selected action can be identified by its id and newState (the latter if applicable only) ‘Follow’ button + menu: id: follow, newState: Follow/Hold/Default ‘Mark for follow up’ button: id: flag, newState: true/false ‘Favorite’ button: id: favorite, newState: true/false ‘Open Thing Inspector’ button id: open Business Actions: id: the ThingAction id

For ‘Update’, please refer to event ‘feedSubmit’

events.name: feedSubmit

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Feed text

events.description: Fired when a new feed entry is submitted.

methods.name: attachActionSelected

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the actionSelected event of this sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar itself.

Fired when any of the social action’s toolbar buttons except ‘Update’ or any of the business action’s menu items resp. buttons is pressed. The selected action can be identified by its id and newState (the latter if applicable only) ‘Follow’ button + menu: id: follow, newState: Follow/Hold/Default ‘Mark for follow up’ button: id: flag, newState: true/false ‘Favorite’ button: id: favorite, newState: true/false ‘Open Thing Inspector’ button id: open Business Actions: id: the ThingAction id

For ‘Update’, please refer to event ‘feedSubmit’

symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38. Instead, use the sap.m.Toolbar or sap.m.OverflowToolbar control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.ActionBarSocialActions
symbols.description:
Enumeration of available standard actions for 'sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar'. To be used as parameters for function 'sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.getSocialAction'.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/ux3/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'ActionBarSocialActions'.

symbols.description: DataSetSimpleView provides a simple view example for DataSet usage.

properties.name: floating
properties.description: When true the DatSet items are floating containers. When set to false The Items are rendered in a 1 column Layout.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
If the pagination feature is used without specifying a scroll area, a height for the dataset must be defined.

Since: 1.13.0.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Icon source for this view

properties.name: iconHovered
properties.description: icon: hovered state

properties.name: iconSelected
properties.description: icon: selected state

properties.name: initialItemCount
properties.description:
If this value is greater zero only this amount of items is loaded in the first place. New items are loaded automatically when the user scrolls down. The number of items which are reloaded can be defined with the property "reloadItemCount"

Since: 1.13.0.

properties.name: itemMinWidth
properties.description:
When itemMinWidth>0 and the property floating is true the given minimum width in pixels is set to DatSet items. A minimum width must be given when the property responsive is set.

Since: 1.9.2.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the View

properties.name: reloadItemCount
properties.description:
This number defines the item count which is reloaded on scroll if initialItemCount is enabled.

Since: 1.13.0.

properties.name: responsive
properties.description:
When true and the property floating is true the DatSet items are floating containers filling the whole space of a row.

Since: 1.9.2.

properties.name: scrollArea
properties.description:
ID of the DOM Element or jQuery reference to the dom which holds the scrollbar for the dataset

Since: 1.13.0.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.ux3.ExactArea
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute
symbols.description: An element for defining attributes and sub-attributes used within the Exact pattern.

properties.name: additionalData
properties.description: An example for additional data are database keys

properties.name: autoActivateSupply
properties.description: If you want the supply function to be called on every select, you can set the autoActivateSupply attribute to true. In this case, supplyActive is automatically set to true on every unselect.

properties.name: listOrder
properties.description:
The order how the sublists of this attribute should be displayed.

Since: 1.7.1.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Specifies whether the attribute shall be selected

properties.name: showSubAttributesIndicator
properties.description: Specifies whether the attribute shall have sub values for visual purposes. The indicator which is a little arrow beside an attribute in the list is computed automatically (getShowSubAttributesIndicator_Computed() of sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute). In the case that a supply function is attached, and the supplyActive attribute has value 'true', then the Exact pattern needs a hint if sub attributes are available. The showSubAttributesIndicator attribute is considered then and has to be maintained. If the back-end does not support count-calls, for example, showSubAttributesIndicator should be set to true.

properties.name: supplyActive
properties.description: The supplyAttributes event is only fired if supplyActive has value true which is the default. After firing the event, the attribute is automatically set to false. The idea is that a supply function is called only once when the data is requested. To enable the event again it is possible to manually set the attribute back to true.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The attribute name

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Specifies the width of the corresponding list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500.

Since: 1.7.0.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser
symbols.description: Attribute browse area used within the Exact pattern. The main benefit of this control is the high flexibility when large data amounts shall be displayed in the form of structured data sets with a high or low interdependency level. From lists - which can be nested according to the defined attributes - the user can choose entries and thereby trigger the display of further information, depending on the chosen entry/entries (multiple selection supported).

properties.name: enableListClose
properties.description: Enables the close icons of the displayed lists.

properties.name: enableReset
properties.description: Whether the reset functionality should be available in the header area.

properties.name: enableSave
properties.description:
Whether the save button should be available in the header area.

Since: 1.9.2.

properties.name: headerTitle
properties.description: Title text in the header of the Exact Browser.

properties.name: listHeight
properties.description: The height of the list area in px.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: Whether the header area of the ExactBrowser should be shown.

properties.name: showTopList
properties.description:
Whether the top list of the ExactBrowser should be shown. When the property is set to false the application must ensure to select top level attributes appropriately.

Since: 1.7.0.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title text in the list area of the Exact Browser. The title is not shown when the property showTopList is set to false.

properties.name: topListOrder
properties.description:
The order how the sublists of the top level list should be displayed.

Since: 1.7.1.

properties.name: topListWidth
properties.description:
Specifies the width of the top list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500.

Since: 1.7.0.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.ux3.Feed
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38. Instead, use any sap.ui.layout container control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk
symbols.description: The unit that is embedded - single-wise or in a multiple way - into a Feed control. The control provides a set of properties for text, sender information, time stamp, comments, and functions such as flagging the entry to be favorite, shared, or flagged.

experimental.text: The whole Feed/Feeder API is still under discussion, significant changes are likely. Especially text presentation (e.g. @-references and formatted text) is not final. Also the Feed model topic is still open.

properties.name: commentChunk
properties.description: This flag changes a FeedChunk into a CommentChunk. In this case, it can not have own comments, furthermore it must be assigned to a FeedChunk.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.4.0. Not longer used. If a chunk is a comment is determined from hierarchy. If the parent is a chunk it's automatically a comment.

properties.name: deletionAllowed
properties.description: Flag if the deletion of the chunk shall be allowed

properties.name: enableComment
properties.description: If true the comment action is enabled.

properties.name: enableFavorite
properties.description: If true the favorite action is enabled.

properties.name: enableFlag
properties.description: If true the flag action is enabled.

properties.name: enableInspect
properties.description: If true the inspect action is enabled.

properties.name: enableShare
properties.description: If true the share action is enabled.

properties.name: favorite
properties.description: Defines whether the entry shall be displayed as favorite. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

properties.name: feederSender
properties.description: Sender for the comment feeder This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control.

properties.name: feederThumbnailSrc
properties.description: URL to the thumbnail image for the comment feeder. This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control.

properties.name: flagged
properties.description: Defines whether the entry is flagged. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

properties.name: sender
properties.description: Sender of the chunk

properties.name: shared
properties.description: Defines whether the entry shall be shared. This property is not supported for comment chunks.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The FeedChunk text. @References are supported.

properties.name: thumbnailSrc
properties.description: URL to the thumbnail image.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Format is ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ, Z meaning the time is in UTC time zone

aggregations.name: actionMenuItems
aggregations.description: MenuItems to open when there is a click on the action menu button

aggregations.name: comments
aggregations.description: Comments on this chunk

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FeedChunk.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

returnValue.description: Value of property commentChunk

methods.description:
Gets current value of property commentChunk.

This flag changes a FeedChunk into a CommentChunk. In this case, it can not have own comments, furthermore it must be assigned to a FeedChunk.

Default value is false.

deprecated.text: Not longer used. If a chunk is a comment is determined from hierarchy. If the parent is a chunk it's automatically a comment.

symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38. Instead, use the sap.m.FeedListItem control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.Feeder
symbols.description: This feed control flavor represents a lean common feed, or a comment feed, with a text commit function. The control can be used stand alone or in a multiple way, and generally would be integrated directly into a UIArea.

experimental.text: The whole Feed/Feeder API is still under discussion, significant changes are likely. Especially text presentation (e.g. @-references and formatted text) is not final. Also the Feed model topic is still open.

properties.name: placeholderText
properties.description: This property could be used for costum placeholder. If it is not set, the default text is used.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text for the Feeder. @References are supported.

properties.name: thumbnailSrc
properties.description: URL to the thumb nail image This property is optional if the feeder is a sub-control of a feed or a feedChunk control. In this case the value of the feed or feddChunk control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed or feedChunk control.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type and size of the Feeder

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Feeder.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: submit

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text that is submitted

events.description: Event is fired when the entered text is submitted

methods.name: attachSubmit

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.ux3.Feeder itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the submit event of this sap.ui.ux3.Feeder.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.Feeder itself.

Event is fired when the entered text is submitted

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.FeederType
symbols.description:
Type of a Feeder.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/ux3/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'FeederType'.

experimental.text: The whole Feed/Feeder API is still under discussion, significant changes are likely. Especially text presentation (e.g. @-references and formatted text) is not final. Also the Feed model topic is still open.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar
symbols.description: Provides enhanced navigation capabilities and is the parent control of NavigationItem. It is displayed in the form of a horizontal line with switching markers depending on the currently selected item. The size of an item which is currently chosen by the user is enlarged. In the case that a large number of items are defined for the bar, this is made transparent to the user by showing symbols for scrolling options (forwards and backwards) to see the next or previous items.

properties.name: overflowItemsToUpperCase
properties.description:
Sets the appearance of the menu items in the overflow menu to uppercase

Since: 1.36.

properties.name: toplevelVariant
properties.description: Defines whether the navigation bar shall have top-level appearance

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: If the navigation items need to have a different parent than the NavigationBar, alternatively the associatedItems association can be used. The NavigationBar follows the approach to use the items aggregation. If this aggregation is empty, associatedItems is used.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar

symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38. Instead, use the sap.m.IconTabBar, sap.m.TabContainer or sap.uxap.ObjectPageLayout control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem
symbols.description: Is the item to be used within the NavigationBar

properties.name: href
properties.description: Defines the link target URL. This property is optional and should only be set when required! The use of the href property is to not only allow users to navigate in-place by left-clicking NavigationItems, but also to allow right-click and then "open in new tab" or "open in new window". As long as href is not set, an empty window will open and stay blank. But when href is set, the new window/tab will load this URL and it is the application's responsibility to display what the user expects (e.g. the Shell, with the respective NavigationItem being selected).

properties.name: visible
properties.description:
Whether the NavigationItem is currently visible. When making NavigationItems invisible at runtime it is the application's responsibility to make sure it is not the currently selected one - or to select another one in this case.

Since: 1.9.0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar
symbols.description: A NotificationBar is a "toolbar" that can be added to a page to show messages and notifications from the application. Its position, height and width is inherited from the element that the notification bar is added to. The NotificationBar uses position: fixed; to always stay at the bottom of the screen. This CSS may sometimes cause issues when nested deeply inside other controls. To have a proper behavior of the NotificationBar use it as high in the control hierarchy as possible.

properties.name: alwaysShowToggler

This property defines if the toggler should be displayed the whole time when the NotificationBar is shown.

Since: 1.24.5.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.QuickView
symbols.description: QuickView is a small popup with a short overview of a Thing. QuickView is shown when a user holds the mouse pointer over a related screen element.

properties.name: favoriteActionEnabled
properties.description: Favorite action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

properties.name: favoriteState
properties.description: State Of favorite Action

properties.name: firstTitle
properties.description: Thing name shown in the header of the QuickView

properties.name: firstTitleHref
properties.description: URI to Thing Inspector

properties.name: flagActionEnabled
properties.description: Flag action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

properties.name: flagState
properties.description: State of Flag Action

properties.name: followActionEnabled
properties.description: Follow action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

properties.name: followState
properties.description: Follow State of a Thing

properties.name: icon
properties.description: URI of the Thing icon image (mandatory). The image is scaled down to the maximal size of 32 pixel (vertical or horizontal).

properties.name: openActionEnabled
properties.description: Open Thing action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

properties.name: secondTitle
properties.description: Optional short text shown under the firstTitle

properties.name: showActionBar
properties.description: Show Action Bar

properties.name: type
properties.description: Thing type (mandatory) like Account, Material, Employee etc. is displayed in a header at the top part of the QuickView.

properties.name: updateActionEnabled
properties.description: Update action enabled/disabled. If disabled the action will be invisible.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Control width as common CSS-size (px or % as unit, for example).

aggregations.name: actionBar
aggregations.description: ActionBar. If no actionBar is set a default ActionBar will be created. In any case, ActionBar is displayed only when the showActionBar property is set to true.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.ux3.QuickView
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38. Instead, use the sap.m.QuickView control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.Shell
symbols.description: The Ux3 GoldReflection Shell, which is an application frame with navigation capabilities. It is supposed to be added to a direct child of the BODY tag of a page and there should be no other parts of the page consuming space outside the Shell.

properties.name: allowOverlayHeaderAccess
properties.description:
Whether the Shell header (Title Area + Header Items) can be accessed when an Overlay, OverlayContainer or ThingInspector is open.

Since: 1.14.0.

properties.name: appIcon
properties.description: The URL of the image to appear in the left part of the header, usually a branding image containing a logo and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first. If the appIcon is set, for accessibility reasons the appIconTooltip must also be set.

properties.name: appIconTooltip
properties.description: The tooltip of the application icon in the header

properties.name: appTitle
properties.description: The application title to appear in the left part of the header, usually a company and/or product name. appIcon and appTitle are both optional and can both be set; in this case the icon appears first.

properties.name: applyContentPadding
properties.description:
Whether the Shell content area should have a theme-dependent padding or not.

Since: 1.9.0.

properties.name: designType
properties.description:
Defines which design type is to be used.

Since: 1.12.0.

properties.name: fullHeightContent
properties.description:
If set to true, the content area has a defined height. This means that any content put inside can use "100%" height in CSS and will then consume all available space. However, if content is larger, scrollbars will appear at the content area of the Shell and not on window level.

Since: 1.9.0.

properties.name: headerType
properties.description: Defines which header type to be used. Depending on the header type some other functionality might be obsolete.

properties.name: logoutButtonTooltip
properties.description:
The tooltip to be displayed for the Logout Button of the Shell. If not set, a text meaning "Logout" in the current language will be displayed.

Since: 1.9.0.

properties.name: paneWidth
properties.description: The width of the right-hand side pane in pixels. The value must be a non-negative integer. The Shell reserves the right to define a minimum width (currently 50px).

properties.name: showFeederTool
properties.description: Whether the "Feeder" tool should be displayed or not.

properties.name: showInspectorTool
properties.description: Whether the "Inspector" tool should be displayed or not.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.7.2. According to the current Ux designs, the ThingInspector should NOT be opened like this from the Tool Pane. And technically, the ThingInspector is not a ToolPopup. Instead trigger it from the respective elements in the Shell content.

properties.name: showLogoutButton
properties.description: Whether the Logoff button in the header should be displayed or not.

properties.name: showPane
properties.description: Whether the pane bar should be displayed at all or not.

properties.name: showSearchTool
properties.description: Whether the "Global Search" tool should be displayed or not.

properties.name: showTools
properties.description: Whether the tool area should be displayed at all or not.

aggregations.name: _paneOverflowMenu
aggregations.description:
The menu that is shown when there are too many pane-bar entries to fit onto the screen. It is shown after a click on the overflow button that appears in that case.

Since: 1.14.0.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: The content to appear in the main canvas. Each modification of this aggregation leads to a re-rendering of the content area - but not to a re-rendering of the complete Shell.

aggregations.name: headerItems
aggregations.description: Controls to appear in the header next to the logout button. It is recommended to only use controls of type Button, MenuButton and TextView. The respective UI guidelines need to be enforced on a higher level.

aggregations.name: notificationBar
aggregations.description:
The NotificationBar which should be integrated into the Shell.

Since: 1.7.0.

aggregations.name: paneBarItems
aggregations.description: The items to appear in the PaneBar.

aggregations.name: paneContent
aggregations.description: The content to appear in the pane area.

aggregations.name: toolPopups
aggregations.description: The items which appear in the ToolPalette and are opened as popup when clicked.

aggregations.name: worksetItems
aggregations.description: The workset items.

associations.name: selectedWorksetItem
associations.description: The ID of the Item that is currently selected. When setting, the NavigationItem itself can be given instead of its ID. There will not be a worksetItemSelected event, the application is responsible to show the proper content according to the newly selected WorksetItem. If the set WorksetItem does not exist in this Shell, the first item (and first sub-item) will be selected after the call. When getting, always the ID is returned, by which the NavigationItem instance can be retrieved.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Shell.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: feedSubmit
events.description: Fired when a new feed entry is submitted.

events.name: logout
events.description: Fired when the user clicks the "Log-off" button

events.name: paneBarItemSelected

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the selected PaneBarItem.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The selected Item

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the selected Item (or null if there is no key)

events.description: An item in the right-hand-side pane bar has been selected, the pane is now visible and can be filled with UI elements.

events.name: paneClosed

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the PaneBarItem to which the closed pane belonged.

events.description:
Fired after a side pane of the shell is closed. It is also fired, when an open pane is closed by calling setShowPane(false), if and only if the pane was opened before.

Since: 1.12.0.

events.name: search
events.description: Fired when search has been triggered.

events.name: worksetItemSelected

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the workset item that has been newly selected by the user. If a top-level item has been clicked which has sub-items, the ID of the currently active sub-item (/leaf) is given.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The selected NavigationItem

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the selected NavigationItem (or null if there is no key)

events.description:
Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.

Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by calling the preventDefault method on the event object.

methods.name: getFullHeightContent

returnValue.description: Value of property fullHeightContent

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fullHeightContent.

If set to true, the content area has a defined height. This means that any content put inside can use "100%" height in CSS and will then consume all available space. However, if content is larger, scrollbars will appear at the content area of the Shell and not on window level.

Default value is false.

Default value is Standard.

methods.name: isPaneOpen
methods.description: Returns 'true' if the side Pane is currently open.

methods.name: openPane

parameters.name: sPaneBarItemId
parameters.description: The ID of the PaneBarItem which should be marked as selected.

methods.description:
Opens the side Pane.

A valid ID of a paneBarItem must be given, so this item can be marked as selected. A "paneBarItemSelected" event is then fired as if the opening was triggered by the user by a click on the respective PaneBarItem. This method can be called (with different IDs) even when the Pane is already open. It has then the same effect as if the user switches between PaneBarItems.

Returns 'this' to allow method chaining.

methods.name: setContent

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The new Content. In this method it must be exactly one control (-tree). Use addContent() to add more control (-trees) to the main content area of the Shell.

parameters.name: bDestroyOldContent
parameters.description: If set, the controls previously contained in the Shell will be destroyed, to avoid memory leaks.

methods.description:
Replaces the existing Shell content with the given Control(-Tree). Only leads to a re-rendering of the content area (not the complete Shell). This method may be more convenient than a series of calls to "removeContent" and "addContent", which each lead to a re-rendering of the content area (but again not of the complete Shell).

By default the old content is not destroyed and is returned by this method in an array for further usage. To avoid memory leaks, the old content should be destroyed (if not needed later), by setting the "destroyOldContent" flag or by destroying it manually later on. If "destroyOldContent" is set, an empty array is returned.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: New value for property designType

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Standard.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bFullHeightContent

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property fullHeightContent.

If set to true, the content area has a defined height. This means that any content put inside can use "100%" height in CSS and will then consume all available space. However, if content is larger, scrollbars will appear at the content area of the Shell and not on window level.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.name: setOffsetRight

parameters.name: px
parameters.description: how many pixels of free space should be next to the Shell (between 0 and 600)

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: optional callback function to call after the animation

parameters.name: outerId
parameters.description: optional id of the content representing the outside sidebar. If specified the width of the content is animated.

methods.description:
Moves the complete Shell away from the right window border by the given number of pixels (left border in RTL case).

So there is space for a sidebar or so outside the Shell. The CSS class 'sapUiUx3ShellOuterSideBar' provides the basic position capabilities for the sidebar DOM element.

This feature is not public. The usage is only granted to special groups on request.

methods.name: setPaneContent

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The new Pane content. In this method it must be exactly one control (-tree). This could likely be a layout or a specific ux3 Pane control. Use addPaneContent() to add more control (-trees) to the Pane.

parameters.name: bDestroyOldContent
parameters.description: If set, the controls previously contained in the pane will be destroyed, to avoid memory leaks.

methods.description:
Replaces the existing side pane content with the given Control(-Tree). This method is optimized to only re-render the pane content (and not the shell) which is faster and smoother than any other way of changing the "paneContent" aggregation.

By default, the old pane content is not destroyed and is returned by this method in an array for further usage. To avoid memory leaks, the old content should be destroyed (if not needed later), by setting the "destroyOldContent" flag or by destroying it manually later on. If "destroyOldContent" is set, an empty array is returned.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 250.

symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38. replaced by sap.m.Shell

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType
symbols.description:
Available shell design types.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/ux3/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'ShellDesignType'.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType.Crystal
properties.description: An even lighter design. It borrows most of its properties from the Light design and just changes a few details like the header colors in order to have a blue design within gold reflection.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType.Light
properties.description: A lighter design. Should be used in combination with the Standard header type.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType.Standard
properties.description: The standard Shell design (dark).

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellHeaderType
symbols.description:
Available shell header display types.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/ux3/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'ShellHeaderType'.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellHeaderType.BrandOnly
properties.description: Only the branding area is visible. Top-level navigation bar, header items, title and icon are not shown.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellHeaderType.NoNavigation
properties.description: Like the Standard Area but without top-level navigation bar.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellHeaderType.SlimNavigation
properties.description: Like the Standard Area but with a leaner top-level navigation bar.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.ShellHeaderType.Standard
properties.description: The standard Shell header.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer
symbols.description: ThingViewer: Same as ThingInspector but decoupled from the Overlay and the ActionBar. The control can be added to a Parent container that has a defined width. The ThingViewer fill the whole container. If the parent container has no width defined the control will not work properly.

symbols.description:
Available ThingViewer header display types.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/ux3/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'ThingViewerHeaderType'.

properties.description: The header content is displayed horizontally above the facet content

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup
symbols.description: A popup which the user can open from the Shell's tool pane. Generally, the starting point would be an icon. For this pop up, buttons can be defined with any text; therefore, it has the same purpose and similar look like any common dialog box. A ToolPopup can have any content. Depending on the application type and design, the structure of the texts and input fields can be for example form-like.

properties.name: autoClose
properties.description:
Determines whether the ToolPopup will auto close when it loses focus. If the user e.g. clicks outside of the ToolPopup it will be closed. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.

Since: 1.13.2.

properties.name: closeDuration
properties.description:
Time in milliseconds for the close animation.

Since: 1.19.0.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: This property is relevant for Shell use: The URL to the icon displayed in the tool area which is used to open the ToolPopup. The recommended size is 32x32px, including some transparent border. Therefore, the content will cover about 20x20px.

properties.name: iconHover
properties.description: This property is relevant for Shell use: The URL to the icon in hover state, displayed in the tool area which is used to open the popup.

properties.name: iconSelected
properties.description: This property is relevant for Shell use: The URL to the icon in selected state displayed in the tool area which is used to open the popup. If no selected icon is given, the hover icon is used.

properties.name: inverted
properties.description:
Specifies whether the ToolPopup has a dark or bright background. If set to true the background and borders will be dark. If false they will be bright. This property only has an effect for the GoldReflection-theme.

Since: 1.11.1.

properties.name: maxHeight
properties.description:
Forces a maximum height of the ToolPopup in pixels. If the ToolPopup content is higher than the ToolPopup, the content will be scrollable.

Since: 1.13.2.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description:
Forces a maximum width of the ToolPopup in pixels.

Since: 1.15.0.

properties.name: modal
properties.description: Specifies whether the popup is modal and blocks any user-interaction with controls in the background. Changing this property while the ToolPopup is open will not have any effect. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.

properties.name: openDuration
properties.description:
Time in milliseconds for the open animation.

Since: 1.19.0.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Determines the title displayed in the pop up window

aggregations.name: buttons
aggregations.description: Defines the buttons to appear in the popup

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Defines the content of the popup

associations.name: defaultButton
associations.description:
Defines one of the buttons that have been provided via button aggregation to be the default button. This default button is initially selected, if no control is set via the initialFocus association explicitly. The default button is activated when Enter is pressed in the context of the dialog and when the currently selected element does not handle the Enter event itself.

Since: 1.20.1.

associations.name: initialFocus
associations.description: Defines the control that will get the focus when the ToolPopup is opened.

associations.name: opener
associations.description: This property is relevant for stand-alone use: This association needs to be set if the ToolPopup should not be opened by/with the Shell. This association contains the instance of the control that assigns the ToolPopup's position.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ToolPopup.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: close
events.description:
Event is fired when the popup closes because the user pressed Escape or the ToolPopup Button in the Shell. This is called before the closing animation.

Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by calling the preventDefault method on the event object.

events.name: closed
events.description: This event is fired after the ToolPopup has finished its closing animation. It is called for EVERY close, regardless of whether the user has triggered the close or whether the ToolPopup was closed via API call.

events.name: enter

parameters.name: originalEvent
parameters.description: The onsapenter event, received by the pop up

parameters.name: originalSrcControl
parameters.description: The control that was focused when the user pressed the Enter key (may be null)

events.description: Event is fired whenever the user clicks the Enter or the Enter key inside the pop up

events.name: iconChanged
events.description: Event is fired when one of the icon properties is modified (Note: The icon is not rendered by the ToolPopup). To be used by other controls which want to update the icon in their UI.

events.name: open
events.description: Event is fired when the popup opens

events.name: opened
events.description:
Event is being fired after the ToolPopup has been opened.

Since: 1.19.0.

parameters.description: The button to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some button to the aggregation buttons.

methods.name: getAutoClose

returnValue.description: Value of property autoClose

methods.description:
Gets current value of property autoClose.

Determines whether the ToolPopup will auto close when it loses focus. If the user e.g. clicks outside of the ToolPopup it will be closed. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used.

Default value is false.

Defines the content of the popup

methods.name: getDefaultButton
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association defaultButton, or null.

methods.name: getEnabled
methods.description:
Indicates whether the ToolPopup is currently enabled or not.

Applications can't control the enabled state via a property. A ToolPopup is implicitly enabled depending on its openState. Descendant controls that honor the enabled state of their ancestors will appear disabled after the ToolPopup is closed.

Since 1.13.1. Whether a dialog is regarded as "enabled" during the state transitions (OPENING, CLOSING) is not fully decided. Currently, it is enabled during the OPENING phase and disabled during the CLOSING phase. The only potential change would be to treat the OPENING phase as disabled as well. Applications should be prepared to receive events from "enabled" controls after they called open() on the dialog until close() is called on it. If the mentioned potential change should happen, the dialog will become enabled only after the transition to OPEN. Events from "enabled" children then can still only arrive between open() and close(), so applications that obey the previous rule should continue to work. Only end users or code that explicitly triggers pseudo user events would notice a difference.
A second aspect that might change is the visual behavior of the content: during the CLOSING phase it 'looks' enabled but in fact it is already disabled. This avoids unnecessary redraws for content that becomes hidden soon. Should this show to be confusing for end users, it might be changed.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Value of property icon

methods.description:
Gets current value of property icon.

This property is relevant for Shell use: The URL to the icon displayed in the tool area which is used to open the ToolPopup. The recommended size is 32x32px, including some transparent border. Therefore, the content will cover about 20x20px.

This property is relevant for Shell use: The URL to the icon in hover state, displayed in the tool area which is used to open the popup.

methods.name: open

parameters.name: my
parameters.description: The ToolPopup's content reference position for docking

parameters.name: at
parameters.description: The "of" element's reference point for docking to

methods.description: Opens the ToolPopup. It is checked which control wants to open the ToolPopup. The Shell was previously set as parent so the corresponding parent element is used to set the correct position of the ToolPopup. If another control (i.e. a button) opens the ToolPopup, the control must be previously set as opener via setOpener to the ToolPopup. Corresponding to this opener the position of the ToolPopup will be set. It's also possible to set the position above, below or left from the opener. This can be done via the possible parameters my and at. These parameters refers to work the same way as they do of sap.ui.core.Popup.open.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38. Instead, use the sap.m.Popover control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.ux3.VisibleItemCountMode
symbols.description:
VisibleItemCountMode of the FacetFilter defines if the FacetFilter takes the whole available height (Auto) in the surrounding container, or is so high as needed to show 5 Items ("Fixed " - default).

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/ux3/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'VisibleItemCountMode'.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.VisibleItemCountMode.Auto
properties.description: The FacetFilter automatically fills the height of the surrounding container. The visibleItemCount property is automatically changed accordingly.

properties.name: sap.ui.ux3.VisibleItemCountMode.Fixed
properties.description: The FacetFilter always has as many items in the FacetFilterList as defined in the visibleItemCount property.

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.ux3.VisibleItemCountMode
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.38
